column1: Some medications have entirely different side effects in the elderly than in younger people.
Other theories view aging as a predetermined process controlled by genes.
Aging is a complex process that varies as to how it affects different people and even different organs.
Most gerontologists (people who study aging) feel that aging is due to the interaction of many lifelong influences.
This is caused by an increase of proteins in the cell membrane and cell structures, not an increase in the cell's fluid.
Tissues that rarely or never regenerate include the nerves, skeletal muscle, heart muscle, and the lens of the eye.
- Dysplasia is fairly common in the cells of the cervix and the lining of the respiratory tract.
